name: Caesars Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas for 3 nights. We usually always stay at the Bellagio but to be honest the last time we were there we felt like it was a little dated and really needs a facelift. We heard that Caesars had gone thru an exstensive renovation and we wanted to give it a try. We also enjoy the European pools that Las Vegas hotels offer and we wanted to try the Venus Pool at the hotel.
reviews.title: I expected a better experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I called to make a reservation I specifically asked if the Venus Pool was open and I was assured that it was and I made our reservation. It also states on their website that it was open. So I felt comfortable that we would be able to enjoy that part of the hotel.......BOY WAS I WRONG!!!
reviews.title: the most amazing hotel

reviews.text: The weather the week we were there was in the mid eighties and beautiful. So when we walked down to the pool we were told by several of the people that work there that the Venus Pool would not be open for several more weeeks and there was nothing they could do. One employee even suggested that they tell people it is open only to get them to make a reservation because once you are there you are not going to leave. In addition at the normal pool if you wanted a lounge chair you had to get up at the crack of dawn to find one available and if you came down any time after that you had to pay $150 for a elevated lounge chair with a $50 min. on food and drink. Talk about a ripoff!!
reviews.title: NOT HAPPY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first bad item on our list.
reviews.title: Great time, a very well run hotel. They do everything right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel does have some very nice restaurants and places to hangout but seems to be very smokey and it is waaaaaay to large...we kept getting lost trying to find our way back tot he room!!! Seriously!!! LOL and no it was not the alcohol!!!
reviews.title: Great location...

reviews.text: On a recent stay at Caesar's Palace my room was not available upon check-in. I was offered an upgraded smoking room at no additional charge but declined due to allergies. I was told that I would be called soon when my room was ready. Approximately 3 hours later I called and asked if the room was ready and advised that it was and to come down and pick up the keys. I was given a very nice upgraded suite. Immediately upon entering the suite there was trash everywhere, the bathroom was a mess with trash cans overflowing and the bed was unmade and covered with food. I called the front desk and told them about the room condition. They sent up security with a set of keys to a new room and escorted me to same. This room was perfect. My luggage that had been checked with valet services was another issue. Upon relocation to my new room, I began calling about sending up my bag. I was told that it was on its to my first room. I can understand that. I was told it would be rerouted. After about 30 minutes or more I still did not have my bag. I called the Bell Hop and was told they couldn't find my bag and they hanged up on me. I had one of the Bell Captains come to my room to inquire what my bag looked like. After another 30 minutes I called guest services and spoke with a delightful young lady - Ashley. She was very sympathetic and personally went to check on my bag. She advised me that the supervisor would call me with an update.
reviews.title: Issues and Problems But Resolution is Key

reviews.text: A short while passed and the supervisor did in fact call me and apologized and advised that the bag had been found and was on its way up to me.
reviews.title: Visited Again, upgraded property, good service, great location

reviews.text: For all of my trouble, Caesar's gave me a $100 credit on my bill.
reviews.title: Good Tradeshow Location but Hard on the Expense Account

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was very nice, a little dated in the furnishings area but certainly acceptable.
reviews.title: Caesar's to the Rescue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our 20+ plus stay at Caesars Palace - hosted a meeting of 500+. Much improved service and venue from prior years. New restaurants are outstanding (Old Homestead Steak House, Beijing Noodle, Central), areas are being renovated and overall this property is still a great value. We have held meetings at this venue for 10+ years. Returning next year. All in all, still a great place to stay in Vegas. Don't miss Old Homestead Steakhouse. had one of my best meals ever there . . .
reviews.title: Nice room but boring casino.

reviews.text: This hotel is smack in the middle of the Las Vegas Blvd strip. I went in June, and the weather is super hot everyday (40 degrees celcius on average) When it's that hot, it's important that the hotel have many, many good pools, and Caesars definitely did. Finding a chair was tricky, but if you walked around enough, someone would be leaving. They charge $1 for a glass of water, never had to pay for water at TI or Palazzo. They had self serve water coolers. Hotel was very clean, rooms were spacious. Stayed in the Forum Tower, which are renovated rooms. Coolest thing was having a TV imbedded in the bathroom mirror! Never seen that before. This hotel is huge....so there is lots of walking just to get out onto the streets. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!!
reviews.title: Great hotel - Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Augustas section of caesars. Was a nice big room. Great view of the Bellagio fountains and strip.
reviews.title: Godd fun get away

reviews.text: Room had a big jetted tub, seperate shower, big comfy bed and lots of room.
reviews.title: There may be no resort fees but there are FEES!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The mini bar is expensive as expected. You can not use the fridge for your own drinks unless you pay $25, so that part sucked.
reviews.title: Don't EVER book your wedding at Casear's Palace

reviews.text: Hotel is huge. very nice and lots to do.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!

reviews.text: We booked one double queen room and 2 single rooms. Check-in was easy and smooth. One of the single rooms was not cleaned yet. As compensation the recepetion desk offered me an upgrade to a deluxe room with whirlpool and bigger bathroom. Nice. I also got a better view. Room was huge, very clean, overall a great stay. Would come back
reviews.title: Excellent service and stay

reviews.text: I came to Las Vegas to meet up with my sister and niether one of us had stayed at Ceasers before. I usally stay at the Bellagio and I was expecting a lower rent version of that hotel. I was pleasantly surprised that both the staff and the physical plant was better than expected. I would stay here again. I was also given a free upgrade to a suite which was a nice room with a sideways view of the strip. The only negative that was that the staff tried to sell me the upgrade first and only gave it to me when I declined. It would have been nice to have simply been given it or not. But, there was a nice mix of restaurants and it managed to have a smaller hotel feel than the Bellagio. And the shows have always been best at Caesars.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: After 2 weeks backpacking around costa rica me and my friend were ready for a spot of luxury and boy did we get it! upon check in we were upgraded to a suite no questions asked!! it was amazing! I booked 2 nights through last minute.co.uk that included breakfast vouchers aswell, which came in handy as every where in and around the hotel we came accross was super expensive even for coffee. Pool was nice too but no spa pool available :-(
reviews.title: awesome!!!

reviews.text: Overall i LOVED this hotel and would definately stay again,
reviews.title: Mixed bag!

reviews.text: Just returned from 4 nights at Caesar's Palace. We chose the hotel for it's central location on the strip. We had specifically booked a room with two beds in the Forum Tower. Upon arrival we were told there were no rooms with 2 beds available in that tower. We were offered a room in the Octavius Tower at an additional $50 a night or a roll-away cot in a room in the Forum Tower. I didn't want to add an extra $200 plus tax to the trip and didn't fancy sleeping on a cot so we opted to just spend the first night in the Octavius. The fact that we were charged for the upgrade put me off staying there in the future. That said, the room in the Octavius was beautiful and it was hard to move into the Forum tower on night two. The second room was just okay ( parking lot view) and the air smelled stale and slightly smoky. Considering the money they are making in the casino, it seems totally ridiculous to charge $12 to use the coffee maker in the rooms.
reviews.title: Beautiful new tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Caesars Palace is my favorite hotel in las vegas so far. Enjoyed the great cool/pool view from18th floor suite in peak summer season. Loved the spacious, clean en suite jacuzzi and the amenities.CP has good restaurants, great shopping experience.
reviews.title: Best of all !!!

reviews.text: I have visited Vegas many times so am aware that the hotels are very large and of course slighly impersonal. This time I was travelling for business as part of a very large conference split over 2 hotels.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location

reviews.text: Check in is fast and efficient, help with your luggage is available if needed. We arrived several hours before check in however the room was available immediately. The room was massive and extremely quiet. The bed was very comfortable and there are black out curtains in the room. There was a desk and somewhere to sit away from the bed, all the standard bedroom facilities but generally a very nice room. Lots of storage and a massive bathroom.
reviews.title: Never Stay At Casears Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with all Vegas hotels there is everything available but i found the staff to be helpful and accomodating. There is every food option you could want and it is a good location midway down the strip. You of course have easy access to the Caesars forum shops and resturants which is a bonus.
reviews.title: Fantastic, close to everything

reviews.text: Whilst I did not get to use the pool area, this looked amazing.
reviews.title: A feast!

reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights in the Augustus Tower. The room was a non-smoking king on the 34th floor with an awesome view of the Bellagio Water Show and down the strip. The room is very large and well appointed. We were invited by Caesar's for the Celine Dion show and 5 nights all fully comped. The service was very good. Our biggest complaint is the highly priced mediocre food at the Central restaurant. All food is very expensive at Caesar's and just about everywhere along the strip. A hot dog was $11.00 at the food court.
reviews.title: Great Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino itself is quit small for such a large property. We actually did better playing the slots at Caesar's than elsewhere. However the slots are definitely much tighter than at the Southern California casinos.
reviews.title: Excellent Property, Wonderful Staff, Great Location

reviews.text: The Celine Dion show was awesome. We have seen many shows and it was the best.
reviews.title: Hotel

reviews.text: This was my first time staying at Caesar's Palace. All I can say is, WOW! I have stayed at numerous properties on the Strip and have always had my favorites, but I was beyond impressed with my overall visit to this property. First the staff are amazing, warm and friendly. I don't think I was able to get by one of them without receiving a greeting or at least a smile. Second, the location of Caesars is perfect. It puts you in the heart of the Strip where pretty much any show or other hotel/casino is simply a short walk or shuttle trip away. Third, definitely one of the top 3 best pools in Vegas! Loads of deck chairs, great staff and amazing pools = 1 Happy Visitor! Fourth, the rooms are comfortable, large, and well maintained.
reviews.title: Caesars is very nice..
Hands-Down Best Vegas Experience. EVER.
reviews.text: So, you ask, why only four stars instead of five? Simply put, the Wi-Fi was horrible. I don't mind paying for a service like Wi-Fi. But if I'm shelling out $15 a day then it better work and work good. Other than this annoyance, everything else about our stay was fantastic.

My friends and I booked 2 rooms for a 3 night stay from fri-sun. To my surprise we had 2 new rooms in the Augustus Tower. absolutely Beautiful, clean rooms, smelled nice. 2 plasma tv's in each room. 1 in the bath, 1 in bedroom.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, bad service
Loved Caesars Palace...........Definitely Not a 5 Star Dump
reviews.text: the pool was beautiful as well, however it was very crowded and the waitress never came by us, when I finally stopped a waitress, she replied "there will be another waitress coming by" and just walked off. the water in the pool was kind of oily. I'm assuming it's from suntan oil/lotion.
the restaurants were ok, a little pricey, more like diner food. with the exception of Viale. I thought the food and service was about average. I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Food Stinks
Ceasar's Palace
reviews.text: the bartenders, cocktail waitresses were horrible!! if they didnt want to be there, then they should find another job. just bad attitudes, possibly overworked, stressed out. they didnt care about you unless you tipped very high. once I started tipping over 20%, I got much better service.
overall, caesar's was a nice hotel but I wouldnt stay there again. I had more fun at Rio a few years back.
reviews.title: A Terrific Surprise !

reviews.text: Like many Las Vegas visitors, I had been waiting to see what the new Augustus Tower at Caesars Palace would be like......a competitor to Bellagio, Wynn, Venetian or Hotel at M-B, or just another Las Vegas disappointment.
reviews.title: New Augustus Tower Opens

reviews.text: First off, for those who have not been to Caesars Palace in several years, the renovation investment has been terrific. The casino's are brighter, the addition of the nightclub, Shaddow Bar, Mesa Grill, Bradley Ogden, 808 really help make the place a destination.
reviews.title: 5 Star dump
Absolutely Brilliant !!!
reviews.text: Arrived at 11 am and was able to check in at 1 pm to the new Augustus Tower on opening day -- knowing that employees have been staying in the tower for the past 3 weeks "breaking it in". Upon arriving in the room, I called the bell desk for my 1 bag -- after 6-7 calls and 3 hours later, the bag arrived (they wanted me to stay in my room to wait for my bag). As it turned out, the "older bellman who was slow so they would appreciate my patience" signed out for my bag but left it in the cloak room. So, I missed 3 hours of either pool time or work-out time.

reviews.title: Missing coffee makers, take a kettle!!
reviews.text: Back to the new Tower: Room is large (>650 sq ft) with a contemporary feel -- with some Barbara Barry design influences. The tower is just off of the new Caesar's reception area -- away from the Casino floor so you feel you have "escaped" the madness a bit. The tower has a seperate walkway for the pool as well --again avoiding flip-flops vs. slot machine conflict. Frette-equivelant linens, down pillows, pillow-top bed, LCD TV's in main room and bath. Bathroom is large (double vanity, large spa tub, seperate shower, hidden toilet area.

reviews.title: Stay here if you hate 100 Degree HOT weather!!!
reviews.text: Right before leaving for dinner, I called housekeeping to request turndown service and was informed that "since the tower is new, they don't have turndown service set-up yet". So I requested that someone bring a new set of towels up and remove the used ones (since there are only 2 sets in each room) so a fresh towel would be available in the AM. Upon returning to the room late, that request was completed.

A group of us stayed at Caesar's palace for my sisters wedding. We arrived at 8am. My mom checked in first and tried to do the "$20 trick" and the guy told her she had to pay $75 extra a night for an upgrade. She denied him. He also said her room wasn't ready. My husband and I along with our 2 friends went to another clerk. The $20 worked like a charm. Our friends booked the cheapest room you could get, gave the clerk a 20 and they were upgraded to a suite in the Augustus tower! They had a double door entry and huge room. We gave the clerk a $20 bill and were also upgraded to Augustus tower and our rooms were available at 8am!! I brought my mom to the same clerk and asked if they had an upgrade for her bc her room wasn't ready and we all wanted to be in the same tower. She hands her $40 and the girl instantly upgrades her to Augustus tower and her room was ready!!!
reviews.title: Huge hotel!

reviews.text: The hotel is HUGE!!!! Go explore it!! There are so many restaurants and high end shopping stores. If you're looking to eat cheap, Caesar's is NOT the place. A slice of pizza is $8! Also don't mOve anything in the room bc you will get charged, like the sodas and alcohol
reviews.title: Just back from Caesars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And snacks.
reviews.title: Caesars Palace - something for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As long as you're in the casino gambling you will get FREE drinks, even top of the notch liquors like grey goose. We played the penny slots just for free drinks lol
reviews.title: Caesars Palace 8/4 - 8/10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools were nice but the life guards are strict, no drinks in the pool. The pool side chairs you have to rent for like $100 so if you want a free chair, get outside very very early.
reviews.title: I stayed in the Augustus Tower. Nice, but not worth the premium price.

reviews.text: I booked two rooms at Caesars Palace a couple of months ago. When we drove in, the check-in scene was chaotic. There were long lines and everyone's check-in took forever. After standing in line for more than half an hour, we finally reached the desk. We were informed that the hotel had overbooked and we would be re-located to the Paris at their expense. We accepted and were given two vouchers for "breakfast" at Viales. The young man at the reception desk was quite clear--the vouchers were for breakfast. We found out the next day that Viales isn't open for breakfast. Caesar's is obviously busier than it can handle. It needs to hire more personnel and train them better.
reviews.title: Caesar's service stinks

reviews.text: AFTER SEEING THE BAD REVIEWS ON DELUXE ROOMS I WAS ON A MISSION TO GET UPGRADED. I USED SOME OF THE IDEAS I READ ABOUT IN PAST REVIEWS. I check in at the airport and told the clerk it was our 40 aniversary and did they put my connection card number on my reservation.I got the number on line before my arrival. The clerk said i have a room in the forum tower. I then pulled out a twenty with a five inside from my pocket and showed him the money he said did you say it was your birthday not listening to word i said before, i said it was our aniversary. He then told me he found a room and could upgrade me to the palace tower. This proves that desk clerks have the authority to upgrade guest but they need a reason to put in comments on the reservation. So tell them this is a special occation and get a players card even if your not a gambler I stayed six nights on vacation. To my surprise ceasars had 25 cent 9/6 jacks or betters vidio pocker slots. This has the best odds with perfect play of any game or slot in the casino. The pool area is fantastic,go in the morning its less crowed and not as hot. If your on a budget eat in the forum shop or on the strip.
reviews.title: PALACE TOWER UPGRADE

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in Caesars back in June 05.
reviews.title: Caesar doesnt hail here!

reviews.text: There is a huge difference between "suites" and the entry level
reviews.title: Could have had a better time

reviews.text: "deluxe rooms", we had to change rooms 3 times before they finally
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed 2 nights at the Augustus Tower in Caesar's, which is very nice and convenient to the lobby, spa and fitness center. The room was very spacious with a partial pool view. Beautiful bath with full jacuzzi tub and separate shower and toilet. When we went to the pool in the early afternoon, could not find a single lounge chair-- all were either taken or had towels draped on them to save them. Ended up sitting on ground next to pool, and we were not the only ones who had to do that. But there were plenty of the pay-to-lay bed-size lounge beds that you have to rent. Guess management figures they'd rather rent out some of those than provide enough chairs for guests. And the regular lounge chairs are crammed side by side with no space in between. OK, next day, go to the fitness center (which I love), then mosey over to pool. Knew it was a risk to not go there first thing in the morning, but still got there around maybe 11:30 and, sure enough, there were no more chairs and we ended up sitting poolside again. Kind of ridiculous. They really need to add more chairs or subtract some of the rental beds/cabanas. Love, love, love the spa - it's so relaxing and pure escape. The slots were very tight. If pool time is important to you, either get there very early, rent a cabana, or stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Want to love it, but some caveats

reviews.text: This place is breath taking.
reviews.title: The bits that werent good we're made up by the willingness of staff to go beyond and make it right.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But after a beyond poor experience at Beijing noodle number 9 I told the front desk. Simply because I was angry and thought the message should get through. The response: "sir you should expect the best at Caesars palace, we apologise, here is a $50 credit on your bill. Eat somewhere tomorrow on us". Beautiful service.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - amazing atmosphere

reviews.text: Again after room service neglected to clean the spa. On check out " we apologise we will take $30 of your bill".
reviews.title: Loved It!!

reviews.text: Besides all this, it is luxury plus.
reviews.title: I came, I saw, I was disgusted

reviews.text: After reading the reviews, we decided to check in at the airport. This was quick and convenient and on arriving at the hotel we are glad we did, the queues for receiption were huge our entire stay.
reviews.title: amazing! what else can you say!

reviews.text: At the airport we were offered an upgrade to the Augustus Tower for $50 (usual price $100 upgade) per night. We would recommend everyone doing this. It has only been opened a few weeks. The rooms are huge and the bathroom has all the amenities you could need. Even better, you did not need to drag your suitcase through the casino as the Augustus Tower is next to the entrance/receiption area.
reviews.title: Picture Perfect Wedding Weekend!
Worth the extra money!!!!
reviews.text: If you can drag yourself out of the room, then Ceasars has all you could dream of without having to venture outside.

reviews.title: Loved Caesars Palace!
reviews.text: On checking out other hotels during our stay, we felt that we had made the best choice of hotel and if we return to Vegas than this is where we will stay.

reviews.title: Great Bachelor Party
reviews.text: My Fiance' and I got married at Caesar's this past weekend. The wedding services were excellent!! I would recommend the Passione Package to anyone who asks. The only drawback is the hotel room itself was not all that great (for a 5 star hotel) We were placed in the Palace Tower. The best place to be right now is the Augustus Tower. Other than that, there are no complaints. You definitely don't ever have to leave the hotel. A must try is the Stage Coach Deli--They have the best sandwiches and 3 days after our wedding, they still gave us free cheesecake!!

description: Every day is spectacular at Caesars Palace. Enjoy the natural and healing powers of water with a treatment at Qua Baths & Spa. COLOR, a Salon by Michael Boychuck, brings Hollywood glam to Las Vegas at his ground-breaking creation. Bobby Flay, Guy Savoy, Nobu Matsuhisa and Francois Payard showcase their culinary star power at the world-renowned restaurants of Caesars Palace. Soak in the daytime excitement of the five acre Garden of the Gods Pool Oasis where six different pool experiences compliment heavenly bodies that adorn its grounds. As night falls, join the electrifying vibe of PURE Nightclub – you never know what celebrity might be in attendance. Star-powered performances by Celine Dion fill The Colosseum and for those looking to dance, Matt Goss thrills audiences in his namesake "The Gossy Room" located on Cleopatra’s Barge. For the discriminating shopper, The Forum Shops at Caesars still stands as the Strip’s premier shopping destination. In addition to the spectacular amenities Caesars Palace is now introducing The Laurel Collection, Las Vegas luxury accommodations, offering guests an elevated experience within the larger destination resort. Combining premiere accommodations of the Augustus and Octavius Towers, The Laurel Collection is focused on providing unique, personal touches that include a private valet entrance, an exclusive registration and a dedicated service staff devoted to creating individualized and expedited service.
